wikipedia_page.main: Robert Russell Race CBE FRS FRCP FRCPath MRCS (28 November 1907 – 15 April 1984) was a British medical doctor and human geneticist.  He was Director of the Medical Research Council Blood Group Unit, of the Lister Institute of Preventive Medicine.  His second wife, whom he married in 1956, was Ruth Sanger, who succeeded him in the post.

response: From 1940-1946 she worked as a haematologist for the Red Cross Blood Transfusion Service in Sydney, Australia. In 1946, she moved to England to work with R.R. Race at the Medical Research Counsil (MRC), Blood Group Unit.  While there, she received a doctorate from the University of London in 1948 on the variety of blood group systems. She returned to Australia after receiving her doctorate, but then moved permanently to the United Kingdom in 1950 and remained at the MRC until 1973.

In 1973, she succeeded R.R. Race as Director of the Medical Research Council's Blood Group Unit at the Lister Institute of Preventive Medicine in London.  She retired in 1983.Mollison, P. L. (2004) "Race, Robert Russell (1907–1984)" in Oxford Dictionary of National Biography, Oxford University Press.
